page.title: 12OLD DARNALL:East Sheffield
page.content: There were three cinemas in{Darnall -called the Balfour Cinema, the Lyric and the Darnall Cinema. They have all been pulled down. Transport in those days consisted of {trams}and a few cars. Darnall was a terminus for tram cars with tram lines on Staniforth Road and Darnall Main Road. The Shizan Restuarant now stands on the spot where Mr, Smith's Cafe used to be and a new purpose-built{library has replaced the mobile library and the private 'Red Circle' where you had to pay to borrow books. In the past few years 12 out of the 20{schools}which were thriving in the area during the 1950's have been closed down, though some have been converted into community centres, store places and workshops.
